title: PEPE‚Äôs frenzy grabs headlines, but MUTM stands out with real-world utility
body: In recent months, the cryptocurrency space has been buzzing with excitement over memecoins, particularly Pepe (PEPE). Inspired by internet culture and driven by viral attention, PEPE has drawn in waves of traders hoping to ride short-term price swings. While the frenzy around memecoins like PEPE may capture headlines, projects like Mutuum Finance (MUTM) are steadily building long-term value through real-world utility, robust infrastructure, and a clear vision for the future of decentralized finance (DeFi). PEPE: popular, loud, and lacking substance but Mutuum Finance (MUTM) building for the future Pepe (PEPE) has become the face of a renewed memecoin mania, capturing the imagination of speculative traders. The appeal lies in its meme-driven branding and rapid price movements. These features generate hype but often lack substance. Traders jump in hoping to double or triple their returns in days, only to exit just as quickly when the next trending token appears. As with many meme-based tokens, PEPE‚Äôs value is largely sentiment-driven, dependent on social media trends and community enthusiasm rather than any underlying technology or utility. Such assets rarely offer mechanisms for sustainable growth, nor do they provide passive income. While they make for exciting headlines, they typically do not contribute to long-term ecosystem development or investor security. Their volatility can lead to significant short-term gains‚Äîbut also steep losses when the market shifts direction. In contrast to the hype-driven chaos of memecoins, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is creating real-world value through its fully decentralized, non-custodial lending protocol. With a total supply of 4,000,000,000 tokens and a clear development roadmap, MUTM offers a structured and sustainable approach to DeFi. It will surely be gaining strong traction among users and investors seeking meaningful financial tools rather than speculative pumps. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) allows users to lend assets into liquidity pools and earn interest based on a dynamic, utilization-driven model. As demand for loans increases within a specific pool, interest rates rise, encouraging more lenders to participate. When borrowers step back due to high costs, rates naturally stabilize. This balance is achieved through smart contract automation, creating a market-efficient yield system that rewards participation without artificial inflation. Users receive mtTokens representing their deposits and accrued interest, providing them with immediate liquidity. These mtTokens can be traded on secondary exchanges or used as collateral to access additional opportunities within the platform. This real utility positions MUTM far beyond the scope of meme tokens, offering actual passive income backed by protocol activity. Strong presale results and rapid community growth Mutuum Finance (MUTM) has already achieved several significant milestones. In Phase 5 of its presale, the project has raised approximately $10.55 million, offering tokens at just $0.03. With more than 12,000 holders and growing, interest in the platform is building steadily. The ongoing $100K giveaway has also helped expand the community and reward early supporters. Unlike memecoins that rely solely on hype, Mutuum is focused on transparency and security. The project recently completed a CertiK audit‚Äîone of the most respected blockchain security assessments‚Äîwith a Token Scan Score of 80.00. The audit included both manual review and static analysis, providing strong assurance to participants and investors. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is being built with Layer-2 integration to enhance its technical performance. This infrastructure choice will significantly reduce transaction costs and speed up operations, addressing two major pain points in traditional DeFi platforms. With faster and cheaper transactions, the platform becomes more user-friendly, ensuring broader accessibility and adoption. By the time the token goes live, Mutuum plans to launch a beta version of its platform, marking the transition from a presale token to experience functional DeFi protocol. This milestone will allow users to experience its features firsthand, including lending, borrowing, and mtToken generation. Stablecoin innovation and treasury strength Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is also preparing to launch a decentralized, fully overcollateralized stablecoin. Unlike traditional stablecoins that depend on fiat reserves or centralized banks, Mutuum‚Äôs stable asset will be backed by on-chain collateral already held within the protocol. The minting process will be algorithmic, ensuring full transparency and dynamic supply adjustment. This stablecoin will offer a more secure borrowing option and provide additional stability to the protocol. Interest payments generated from borrowing activities will be redirected into the ecosystem, strengthening the protocol‚Äôs treasury and increasing sustainability. This approach enhances MUTM‚Äôs long-term value and opens new utility channels for its users. MUTM is designed to grow alongside its protocol. A portion of the platform‚Äôs profits will be used to repurchase tokens from the open market. Those purchased tokens will then be sent to safety-module participants who stake mtTokens in designated contracts. This incentivizes long-term holding, deepens protocol liquidity, and creates demand pressure on the token‚Äôs price. Additional funds will support pool growth and strategic marketing initiatives, ensuring that Mutuum Finance (MUTM) continues to expand its reach. As development continues, the team remains committed to completing all roadmap phases, including institutional partnerships, expansion to multiple blockchains, and the implementation of advanced analytics and compliance standards. These steps will elevate MUTM from a powerful DeFi platform to a cornerstone of decentralized finance infrastructure. For those seeking more than fleeting gains, the time is now to look beyond the memecoin hype and invest in real-world DeFi solutions. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is not just a token‚Äîit‚Äôs a financial ecosystem built for the future. title: 4 Top Crypto to Buy in 2025: BlockDAG, Polkadot, Binance Coin, XRP!
body: The crypto space is constantly shifting, offering plenty of chances for those aiming to jump into what could be the next big mover. With fresh coins emerging and projects pushing boundaries, figuring out the top crypto to buy in 2025 can feel overwhelming. That‚Äôs why this guide highlights key coins expected to perform well in both utility and growth. These picks are based on long-term potential, practical use, and solid performance outlooks. Whether new to crypto or already active, these are the names worth tracking as 2025 approaches. 1. BlockDAG (BDAG) Among the most talked-about choices for 2025 is BlockDAG (BDAG) , now drawing attention for all the right reasons. One of its standout moves is its vesting smart contract, which activates two weeks before its listing and allocates 40% of presale coins to early backers. This means those who joined the presale get to use BDAG on-chain before it‚Äôs live on exchanges, giving them a major head start. BlockDAG‚Äôs presale has now hit $304.5 million, selling over 22.6 billion coins. The batch 29 price is currently $0.0276. Since batch 1, early buyers have already seen 2,660% growth in their funds. The project‚Äôs solid delivery, smart contract execution, and clear roadmap keep it ahead of many rivals. As it nears official launch with strong community backing and a US-based sponsorship, BDAG is lining up as one of the top crypto to buy in 2025. 2. Polkadot (DOT) Polkadot continues to stand out for those seeking dependable projects with tech that serves real-world needs. Its multi-chain structure lets different blockchains communicate, offering better scale, speed, and flexibility. This kind of interoperability makes it a smart choice for future-focused crypto users. With parachains already deployed and more in progress, Polkadot supports dApps and various blockchain-powered tools. As more chains enter the space, Polkadot‚Äôs design could be vital in helping them work together. That‚Äôs why many see DOT as a top crypto to buy in 2025, given its ongoing upgrades and role in expanding blockchain‚Äôs overall use. 3. Binance Coin (BNB) BNB has become much more than a coin linked to the Binance exchange. It powers Binance Smart Chain (BSC), a major player in the DeFi sector. BNB‚Äôs rise has followed Binance‚Äôs own growth, and that trend shows no signs of slowing in 2025. Its built-in demand remains strong due to its use in transaction fees on Binance platforms. As DeFi adoption rises globally and more projects choose BSC, BNB‚Äôs role expands. This gives it both real usage and staying power, placing Binance Coin firmly among the top crypto to buy in 2025. 4. XRP (Ripple) XRP continues to be a major name, especially in cross-border money transfers. Even with past legal pressure, Ripple‚Äôs coin is still used by major banks and services for faster, cheaper global payments. That alone keeps XRP in the spotlight. In 2025, outcomes in Ripple‚Äôs legal cases may strengthen XRP‚Äôs standing even more. If barriers ease, the coin could scale up in global financial systems. With a strong real-world function, XRP remains a top crypto to buy in 2025 for those eyeing international finance solutions. Final Call! Choosing the top crypto to buy in 2025 means more than chasing hype. What really counts is long-term strength and real use. BlockDAG‚Äôs early use case, smart contract rollout, and US-based sponsorship add up to a strong profile. Its steady growth to $304.5 million and 2,660% presale gains highlight why it‚Äôs turning heads. Polkadot, Binance Coin, and XRP also bring serious advantages, offering blockchain links, DeFi infrastructure, and payment speed. All four have features that could shape the crypto space in 2025 and beyond. Focus on utility, clarity, and potential when weighing your picks, and these coins could be key players in the years ahead. title: Bitcoin 656% Cyclical Gain Highlights Deep Market Demand  ‚Äì Glassnode
body: The Bitcoin market continues to react negatively to rising geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran which has induced a wave of concern in the financial markets. Notably, the premier cryptocurrency has entered a consolidation movement between $105,000 ‚Äì $106,000 following slight, after prices crashed to below $103,000 on Friday. Meanwhile, prominent analytics company Glassnode has shared some valuable insight into the Bitcoin market dissecting the growth of the current bull cycle so far. Bitcoin Demand Matches Maturation Rate In an X post on June 14, Glassnode draws comparisons of Bitcoin price growth in the present market cycle to previous ones. Related Reading: $57 Million In Crypto And Counting: Trump‚Äôs World Liberty Connection Notably, the crypto market cycle is a recurring four-year period marked by consecutive phases of accumulation, a bull market, distribution and a bear market. In the last two cycles i.e 2015-2018 and 2018-2022, Bitcoin achieved price gains of 1076% and 1007%, respectively, significantly multiplying its market cap. For the current cycle from 2022 till date, Bitcoin‚Äôs prices have now grown by 656%. While this figure is far off previous cycles, Glassnode reports that it‚Äôs a commendable achievement considering the premier cryptocurrency‚Äôs maturation in the past four years marked by an exposure to institutional investors and a $2 trillion valuation. Generally, assets are expected to produce little exponential growth with continued price growth. This can be seen with gold only achieving an estimated 192% growth over the past 10 years. Therefore, Glassnode notes that Bitcoin‚Äôs 6x market gain since 2022 is highly positive development that reflects a sustainable market demand even as the asset‚Äôs market cap grows. Bitcoin Market Overview At the time of writing, Bitcoin continues to trade at $105,540 following a slight 0.20% gain in the past 24 hours. Meanwhile, the asset‚Äôs daily trading volume is down by 35.39% representing significant fall in market participation. Interestingly, reputable analytics firm Sentora reports the Bitcoin network weekly fees fell by 3.31% following recent negative political events coupled with an already uncertain market sentiment. Meanwhile, exchange inflows also grew by $2.4 billion indicating a significant amount of investors are looking to distribute their holdings while the premier cryptocurrency struggles to re-establish a bullish price direction. Related Reading: Bitcoin To $1 Million? Michael Saylor Laughs Off Crypto Winter Fears Notably, since establishing a new all-time high at $111, 891 on May 22, the maiden cryptocurrency has experienced a significant price correction with prices dipping as low as below $101,000 amidst a host of negative micro-economic events. However, the prevailing sentiment among Bitcoin investors remains bullish according to Coincodex data with the Fear & Greed index at 63 to reflect a solid level of Greed. title: Bitcoin Mirrors Gold‚Äôs Path ‚Äì Analyst Sets Cycle Top Targets At $160K-$180K
body: Bitcoin enters mid-2025 consolidating just below all-time highs, navigating a turbulent year marked by deep macro and geopolitical volatility. The year began with US President Donald Trump‚Äôs renewed tariff policies, which rattled global trade relationships and pressured risk assets. Rising US Treasury yields soon followed, raising concerns of systemic fragility as inflationary pressure collided with tightening liquidity. Most recently, the outbreak of direct conflict between Israel and Iran has escalated fear across financial markets, prompting a shift toward safe havens like gold. Amid this backdrop, Bitcoin has remained resilient, currently consolidating above the $100,000 mark after peaking at $112,000 earlier in the year. While some investors fear increased selling pressure due to global instability, others believe the current structure points to strength rather than weakness. According to top analyst Ted Pillows, nothing has fundamentally changed for BTC. His technical perspective argues that Bitcoin is still mirroring gold‚Äôs long-term trajectory and remains on course for another breakout in the coming weeks. With inflation risks still present, fiat concerns growing, and capital rotating toward scarce assets, many are watching Bitcoin not as a speculative play, but as a macro hedge. A breakout above $112K could trigger the next explosive move. Bitcoin Volatility Spikes As Macro Pressure Builds Bitcoin is holding firm above $103,000 despite failing to break the $112,000 all-time high last week. The rejection led to a sharp 6% correction, with bears attempting to force the price below key demand zones. Yet, despite intense macro pressure and escalating geopolitical risk, Bitcoin remains structurally intact. The conflict between Israel and Iran has sent shockwaves through global markets, pushing safe-haven assets like oil and gold higher while equities waver. Bitcoin, often seen as digital gold, has surprisingly shown strength amid the chaos. The upcoming week could be pivotal for BTC. If tensions worsen and traditional markets slide further, Bitcoin‚Äôs behavior will test its evolving role as a macro hedge. Investors are watching closely to see whether capital continues to rotate into BTC during risk-off conditions. Ted Pillows remains optimistic. His technical analysis suggests that nothing has structurally changed for Bitcoin. According to his view, BTC is tracking closely with gold‚Äôs historical breakout patterns, implying that the digital asset is merely consolidating before another leg up. Pillow‚Äôs long-term outlook sees Bitcoin targeting $160,000‚Äì$180,000 by the cycle top. BTC Consolidates Below Resistance Bitcoin is currently trading at $105,527 after a failed attempt to break through the $112,000 level earlier this month. The chart shows a clear rejection from that all-time high area, pushing price back into the $103,600‚Äì$109,300 range. This zone remains the primary battleground between bulls and bears. The 50-day moving average, currently around $103,426, is acting as dynamic support, while the 200-day MA near $95,650 remains a broader trendline for longer-term holders. Volume has slightly decreased during the recent drop, which could indicate that the sell-off lacks strong conviction from market participants. If BTC holds the $103,600 level‚Äîa previous resistance now flipped support‚Äîit may set the stage for another push toward $109,300. A breakout above that level would likely open the door for price discovery above $112,000. However, if Bitcoin fails to hold the $103,600 area, it risks falling back into the $97,000‚Äì$100,000 region where previous demand was tested in May. title: Legal Expert Warns XRP Holders: Why You Should Not Expect Approval or Price Rally¬†on¬†June¬†16
body: Anticipation is building in the XRP community following a post by XRP Governor on X claiming that a decision in the ongoing Ripple vs. SEC case is expected on Monday, June 16 . According to the post, if the court approves the latest motion, XRP could ‚Äúrise above $5 quickly.‚Äù But not everyone shares this optimism. Legal expert Bill Morgan has issued a sobering reminder that history and legal precedent suggest caution, not celebration. Why Bill Morgan Is Urging Caution Responding to the growing excitement, Bill Morgan, a well-respected lawyer and cryptocurrency legal analyst, urged XRP holders to temper their expectations. He pointed to the court‚Äôs recent history in handling a similar motion‚Äîone that Judge Analisa Torres swiftly rejected despite being jointly filed by both Ripple and the SEC. Perhaps you should not hope for that. It only took 7 days for Judge Torres to reject the last joint motion to modify the judgment to reduce the fine and dissolve the injunction. Less than 7 days to decide the current joint motion may not be the best sign she will grant it. https://t.co/9yFksn6Jrq ‚Äî bill morgan (@Belisarius2020) June 15, 2025 ‚ÄúPerhaps you should not hope for that,‚Äù Morgan warned. ‚ÄúIt only took 7 days for Judge Torres to reject the last joint motion to modify the judgment to reduce the fine and dissolve the injunction. Less than 7 days to decide the current joint motion may not be the best sign she will grant it.‚Äù His concern is based on timing. A quick ruling, while seemingly efficient, may indicate that the judge is not open to altering her original judgment. This mirrors the court‚Äôs earlier rejection of a joint request from Ripple and the SEC to reduce Ripple‚Äôs penalties and dissolve the ban on certain XRP sales. That motion was denied in just one week. Price Speculation vs. Legal Reality XRP Governor‚Äôs claim that XRP could surge past $5 if the motion is approved has fueled bullish speculation. But Morgan‚Äôs warning serves as a reminder that legal processes don‚Äôt operate on price predictions. Even if the motion were granted, it wouldn‚Äôt necessarily trigger an immediate or sustained rally. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 XRP‚Äôs market performance is influenced by a wide range of factors, including broader market sentiment, macroeconomic conditions, and regulatory clarity. A positive court ruling could enhance Ripple‚Äôs legal position, but it doesn‚Äôt necessarily promise a dramatic price surge, given the crypto market‚Äôs volatility. What‚Äôs Really at Stake on June 16 The motion currently before the court seeks to finalize the penalty phase of the case and potentially lift the injunction that prevents Ripple from selling XRP to institutional investors in the U.S. While it‚Äôs a critical step in closing the multi-year legal battle, it‚Äôs not the dramatic conclusion some are expecting. This case began in December 2020, when the SEC sued Ripple for allegedly selling XRP as an unregistered security. In July 2023, Judge Torres issued a split ruling, finding that XRP sales on exchanges did not violate securities laws, but institutional sales did. As June 16 approaches , Morgan‚Äôs advice is both timely and necessary: don‚Äôt confuse legal procedure with market momentum. A quick decision isn‚Äôt always a favorable one, and expecting a $5 XRP based solely on a court filing could lead to disappointment. title: Russia Paid Teenage Spies in Bitcoin, Blockchain Forensics Reveal
body: Russian intelligence agencies are increasingly relying on Bitcoin to fund covert operations across Europe, including the recruitment of teenagers as spies. Key Takeaways: Russian intelligence is using Bitcoin to fund covert operations, including the recruitment of teenage spies. Blockchain forensics traced espionage payments to wallets linked to the FSB, showing structured laundering patterns. This case is part of a broader trend, with crypto also used to finance propaganda and sabotage across Europe. A Reuters investigation , conducted with blockchain forensics firms Global Ledger and Recoveris, has revealed how the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) used crypto to finance espionage. One case involved Canadian national Laken Pavan, who was just 17 when he was recruited by the FSB after traveling to Donetsk to join pro-Russian forces. Teen Spy Case Reveals Russia‚Äôs Use of Coercion and Crypto Payments After several days in detention, Pavan was coerced into spying for Russia and assigned a handler known as Slon, Russian for ‚Äúelephant.‚Äù His instructions included traveling across Europe to collect intelligence, with payments sent in Bitcoin. After receiving just over $500 in BTC while in Copenhagen, Pavan fled to Poland, where he turned himself in on May 22, 2024. He was later sentenced to 20 months in prison by Polish authorities. The payment Pavan received was traced to two intermediary wallets by blockchain analysts, which had received significant funds from a larger wallet created in June 2022. That wallet has since processed more than $600 million in Bitcoin, including transactions routed through Garantex, a sanctioned Russian crypto exchange. JUST IN: Russia's central bank showcases #Bitcoin as the most profitable investment over the past year pic.twitter.com/y9MB4vyGAD ‚Äî Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) May 15, 2025 Global Ledger‚Äôs analysis found that the wallets linked to Pavan‚Äôs payments operated exclusively during Moscow business hours, pointing to a highly structured laundering network. ‚ÄúTransactions from wallets linked to the FSB followed a structured laundering pattern, involving fund splitting, mixing with larger sums, and routing through unconnected deposit wallets,‚Äù Global Ledger said in its report. The case is not isolated. According to Marcin Zarakowski, CEO of Recoveris, Russian intelligence has used Bitcoin to fund multiple covert operations. ‚ÄúThis method has been uncovered on multiple occasions,‚Äù he said, citing a 2023 case involving young Belarusians and Ukrainians who were paid in crypto by the GRU to install surveillance devices and spread propaganda in Poland. Some were even paid in BTC to commit acts of arson. 161 Bitcoin Wallets Tied to Russia‚Äôs FSB Show Patterned Activity Recoveris has also identified a network of 161 Bitcoin addresses linked to the FSB, with hundreds of transactions occurring within 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Moscow time. Russia‚Äôs reliance on crypto extends to mercenary funding in Donbas and payments to European politicians for disseminating pro-Kremlin narratives. As reported, Russia is exploring ways to use cryptocurrencies to settle grain export payments, as the country looks to bypass Western sanctions and modernize its trade infrastructure. More recently, Russia‚Äôs central bank announced that it is allowing qualified investors limited access to crypto-linked financial products. Under the new guidance, banks and financial firms can offer derivatives and securities tied to cryptocurrency prices, though these products must be non-deliverable and settled in fiat. The post Russia Paid Teenage Spies in Bitcoin, Blockchain Forensics Reveal appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Dogecoin‚Äôs (DOGE) Price Could Dump to 2025 Lows if This Support Fails: Analyst
body: TL;DR Dogecoin‚Äôs price, alongside almost the entire cryptocurrency market, plunged at the end of the business week following the attacks from Israel against Iran. Although the asset has recovered some ground since the Friday lows, there is still a considerable threat that it could plummet by another 30% if it breaches a certain support line, according to popular crypto analyst Ali Martinez. #Dogecoin $DOGE must hold above $0.168 to avoid a 30% price drop! pic.twitter.com/PDhqo7fpcK ‚Äî Ali (@ali_charts) June 15, 2025 The support in question is the lower boundary of a symmetrical triangle pattern, which has been formed since the early 2025 highs when DOGE‚Äôs price challenged the $0.4 level on a few occasions. However, the largest meme coin has been unable to maintain its run and dumped hard in the following months. It bottomed in early April, during the worst period of the trade war between the US and the rest of the world, at roughly $0.13. Its recovery since then saw DOGE go above $0.25 in May, but that was short-lived, and it‚Äôs now trading close to $0.175 following a 4.5% weekly decline and a 23% monthly decrease. If the painful scenario outlined by Martinez materializes, DOGE‚Äôs price will tumble to a new yearly low of under $0.12. Andrew Griffiths‚Äôs analysis also leaned toward a bearish future for the largest meme coin, as it had charted a few consecutive lower highs. He described it as an ‚Äúevident sign of bearish rejection.‚Äù #DOGE Analysis: A rising wedge has formed on the chart, breaking downwards, indicating a bearish continuation. The price tried to retest the wedge‚Äôs base (red zone), showing lower highs‚Äîan evident sign of bearish rejection. title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: BTC Holds Above $105,000 Despite Selling Pressure
body: Bitcoin (BTC) extended its losses for a second consecutive day, with the price down 0.52% as it struggles to stay above $105,000. The flagship cryptocurrency is currently trading at around $104,951. BTC lost momentum after reaching an intraday high of $110,355 thanks to macroeconomic factors and escalating geopolitical tensions after Israel struck key targets in Iran. Corporate Bitcoin Holdings Could Become A Challenge Roxom Global CEO Borja Martel Seward has warned that when the Bitcoin bull market ends, a bearish phase could cause several Bitcoin treasury companies to struggle. Bitcoin has charted its own course despite growing macroeconomic uncertainties impacting the traditional and crypto markets. According to Seward, Bitcoin operates to its own ‚Äúbeating drum rhythm,‚Äù operating as an independent and contrarian asset in an economy dealing with cooling Fed rate cut expectations, quantitative tightening, US Treasury General Account replenishment, and potential Bank of Japan rate hikes. ‚ÄúBitcoin goes at its own pace, bitcoin is independent, bitcoin has its own cycles.‚Äù Bitcoin and the wider crypto market are experiencing a bull run, which Seward believes could continue for a few months. Several other proponents of the asset, including Tim Draper, echoed the sentiment, asserting that Bitcoin could surge to new highs by the end of 2025. However, Seward cautioned against Bitcoin and crypto, stating, ‚ÄúEventually, the bull market will finish. We will enter into a more bearish phase. This euphoria, this mania will dissipate. Some companies will go underwater, and the market structure will reset.‚Äù The warning comes amid a growing trend of public and private companies adding Bitcoin to their treasury reserves. The trend was pioneered by Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy, which has become the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin . According to Seward, these companies' adoption of Bitcoin presents a unique dynamic for upcoming market shifts. ‚ÄúWe will have to see how what today right now is a blessing regarding the bitcoin treasury companies turns out to play once the bear market hits, and we‚Äôll see if treasury companies start selling or not.‚Äù Top Indicators Hint At $230,000 Peak CoinGlass has urged investors to ‚Äúhold 100%‚Äù at current prices even as the asset reported record price levels and 30% gains in Q2. While Bitcoin may be consolidating after reaching record highs, a list of classic on-chain indicators is showing no signs of market exhaustion. CoinGlass‚Äô ‚Äúbull market peak‚Äù selection contains 30 potential selling triggers that aim to highlight long-term Bitcoin price tops. According to CoinGlass, none of the indicators are flashing a top signal. Popular trader Cas Abbe posted on X, stating, ‚ÄúNone of the 30 major top indicators on Coinglass have triggered yet. Not Pi Cycle, Not MVRV, Not even RSI. According To these models $BTC will be $135K to $230K this cycle. This ain‚Äôt the top.‚Äù Bitcoin (BTC) Price Analysis Bitcoin (BTC) lost momentum this week after crossing $110,000 on Monday. While it stalled after reaching this level, market watchers were hopeful of a push higher as bullish sentiment persisted. However, a dramatic escalation in Middle East tensions saw markets plunge, with BTC dropping to $105,828 on Thursday and falling to a low of $102,832 on Friday as bearish sentiment took hold. According to analysts, BTC has encountered downside volatility after it failed to stay above the crucial $106,000 level. Analyst Michael van de Poppe flagged the $106,000 level as vital for maintaining upward momentum. According to van de Poppe, BTC‚Äôs latest rally was rejected after testing $106,000, with the price falling back between the $104,000-$105,000 region. If BTC dips below $105,000 again, it could drop to $100,000 by the end of June, mimicking a similar rejection that saw the price drop sharply to $100,000. BTC registered a sharp drop on Monday (June 2), falling to a low of $103,768. It recovered from this level to register a marginal increase and settle at $105,092. The price lost momentum on Tuesday, falling 0.44% to $105,436. Sellers retained control on Wednesday as BTC fell almost 1%, slipping below $105,000 and settling at $104,752. Bearish sentiment intensified on Thursday as BTC fell 3%, falling to a low of $100,424 before settling at $101,614. The price recovered on Friday, rising nearly 3% to $104,378. Price action remained positive over the weekend as BTC rose 1.15% on Saturday and registered a marginal increase on Sunday to reclaim $105,000 and settle at $105,784. Source: TradingView BTC started the week on a bullish note, surging over 4% to cross $110,000 and settle at $110,251. The price fell to a low of $108,335 on Tuesday but recovered to register a marginal increase and settle at $110,253. Sellers took control on Wednesday as buyers lost momentum. As a result, BTC fell 1.42% and settled at $108,687. Bearish sentiment intensified on Thursday as the price plunged nearly 3% and settled at $105,828. BTC fell to an intraday low of $102,832 on Friday. However, it recovered from this level to register a marginal increase and settle at $106,106. Price action was back in the red on Saturday, with BTC down nearly 1%, trading at $105,482. The current session sees the price marginally down as buyers and sellers struggle to establish control. title: Experts predict when quantum computers will break Bitcoin‚Äôs encryption
body: Recent advances in quantum computing have reignited concerns about the security of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin ( BTC ). Most notably, IBM (NYSE: IBM ) plans to launch the world‚Äôs first fault-tolerant quantum computer, IBM Quantum Starling, by 2029, a major leap from today‚Äôs error-prone machines. As these developments unfold, experts are debating when quantum technology might break Bitcoin‚Äôs cryptographic defenses, specifically, its elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) and SHA-256 hashing, which secure wallets and transactions. In this context, Finbold has gathered expert insights on when quantum computing could threaten Bitcoin. Craig Gidney In May 2025, Google quantum researcher Craig Gidney warned that the timeline might be shorter than expected. His findings revealed that breaking RSA encryption may require 20 times fewer quantum resources than previously estimated. While Bitcoin doesn‚Äôt use RSA, it does rely on ECC, which, like RSA, can be broken by Shor‚Äôs algorithm. Although Gidney didn‚Äôt directly mention Bitcoin, his research targeted encryption methods that underpin crypto wallets and, in some cases, transactions. He suggested a potential threat window between 2030 and 2035, depending on advancements in error correction. ‚ÄúI estimate that a 2048-bit RSA integer could be factored in under a week by a quantum computer with fewer than one million noisy qubits,‚Äù Gidney wrote. Adam Black In contrast, Adam Back, an early Bitcoin adopter and CEO of Blockstream, remains more cautious. In April 2025, he argued that quantum computers likely won‚Äôt pose a serious threat for at least two decades. Still, he acknowledged that future breakthroughs could force holders to migrate their coins to quantum-resistant addresses, including possibly Satoshi Nakamoto‚Äôs untouched stash, which could reveal whether the mysterious founder is still alive. David Carvalho Meanwhile, in a June 2025 opinion published by Cointelegraph , David Carvalho, CEO of Naoris Protocol, issued a more urgent warning. He claimed that quantum computers could crack Bitcoin within five years unless it quickly upgrades its cryptography. Carvalho specifically pointed to the emergence of technologies like Microsoft‚Äôs Majorana chip as a sign that powerful quantum systems are already on the horizon. According to him, about 30% of Bitcoin is currently stored in vulnerable addresses, and a single breach could shatter the trust built over the network‚Äôs 16-year history. ‚ÄúA breach would be catastrophic for holders, whose funds would be gone forever, and the ecosystem at large. It would prove that the unbreakable system can be broken. That‚Äôs why BlackRock recently acknowledged the threat of quantum to Bitcoin in its updated spot ETF filing. That‚Äôs why the time to act is now, before it‚Äôs too late,‚Äù he said. Chamath Palihapitiya Similarly, back in December 2024, as reported by Finbold, billionaire investor Chamath Palihapitiya cautioned that Bitcoin‚Äôs SHA-256 encryption might be broken within two to five years due to the pace of quantum progress. His warning came after Google unveiled its 105-qubit Willow chip, which was viewed as a significant milestone. He estimated that around 8,000 such chips could potentially break Bitcoin‚Äôs encryption. While scaling to that level remains a major hurdle, Palihapitiya urged blockchain developers to start reworking hashing algorithms now. Ultimately, the quantum threat to Bitcoin hinges on creating fault-tolerant quantum computers with millions of qubits, a milestone that‚Äôs still years away. Featured image via Shutterstock The post Experts predict when quantum computers will break Bitcoin‚Äôs encryption appeared first on Finbold .

title: How US Firms and Small Businesses Are Increasing Crypto Adoption: Coinbase Research
body: It has been over a decade and a half since Bitcoin and blockchain technologies emerged. However, the cryptocurrency sector has witnessed more widespread adoption than ever before over the past year. According to the State of Crypto 2025 report from the digital asset exchange Coinbase‚Äôs research team, small business operations and real-world use cases, like payroll and remittances from institutional investors, have been driving stablecoin growth. U.S. Businesses Embrace Crypto Coinbase conducted surveys for small and medium businesses (SMBs) and institutional investors in April and January 2025, respectively, for the report. The exchange found that claimed ownership of crypto is more common than people think; a rising number of institutions are working on blockchain initiatives and have included such plans in their corporate strategies. Six in ten executives of Fortune 500 (F500) companies said their firms are building on-chain initiatives. Roughly 47% of respondents reported that their companies have increased their investment in blockchain technology. Also, the number of on-chain projects per company has risen 67% year-on-year (YoY) from 5.8 to 9.7. The top types of on-chain initiatives seen among the F500 include payment/settlements, cross-border transfers, supply chain management, corporate treasury, and blockchain infrastructure. Coinbase found that 17 unique on-chain initiatives were announced by F100 companies last quarter and 46 between Q3 2024 and Q1 2025. There is also increased diversity from financial service and technology companies to auto and transportation, retail, food and beverage, and healthcare firms. How Can Regulatory Clarity Help? Examining SMBs, Coinbase found that 34% of such businesses currently use crypto; 46% of those who do not are likely to start within the next three years. At least 82% of SMBs believe crypto can address some of their financial pain points. ‚Äú2025 has been a triple-double for crypto among SMBs,‚Äù Coinbase stated, adding that the number of SMBs using crypto and stablecoins has doubled YoY. This increased crypto adoption has driven stablecoin transfer volumes to unprecedented levels. The sector witnessed its two highest monthly organic transfer volumes in December 2024 ($719 billion) and April 2025 ($717.1 billion). Since 2019, the number of people holding stablecoins has grown to over 160 million. Stablecoin holders have surpassed the population of the ten largest cities in the world combined and exceed the 142 million combined users of the U.S. Big Four mobile banking apps. Meanwhile, Coinbase highlighted the role regulatory clarity could play in the full realization of crypto‚Äôs potential. Nine in ten F500 executives agree with the exchange, as well as 72% of SMBs. The post How US Firms and Small Businesses Are Increasing Crypto Adoption: Coinbase Research appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Cryptocurrency Prices Fluctuate While Bitcoin Solaris Guarantees 187% Returns for Presale Investors
body: This week, the crypto market responded to escalating geopolitical tension and liquidity rotation. Bitcoin fell nearly 4%, Ethereum and Solana dipped more than 8%, and the total market cap slid by over $250 billion. Barron‚Äôs reports that gold, not crypto, is attracting flight-to-safety flows. The Economic Times links this drop directly to renewed conflict and market stress. While price dips dominate headlines, a growing cohort of investors is moving capital into assets with clear frameworks, capped supply, and meaningful participation models. That‚Äôs where Bitcoin Solaris enters the picture ‚Äî a protocol quietly offering structure in a market often ruled by speculation. Scarcity That‚Äôs Locked, Not Leveraged Bitcoin Solaris (BTC-S) follows the same foundational limit that gave Bitcoin its power: a maximum of 21 million tokens. But unlike most presale models, Solaris doesn‚Äôt leave room for manipulation after launch. There are no token printing functions, no inflation-based emissions, and no surprise unlocks. Only 4.5 million tokens, 20% of total supply are reserved for presale across all phases. Early buyers could see massive gains at the projected $20 exchange listing: even now in phase 7 at $7, presale participants are still positioned for an expected 186% return. These figures aren‚Äôt abstract ‚Äî they‚Äôre derived directly from the stated public benchmarks and token supply math. Participation Without Barriers The typical mining story begins with capital: GPUs, rigs, validators, locked capital in staking pools. Bitcoin Solaris breaks that mold. Its mobile-native infrastructure allows BTC-S to be mined using smartphones. Not through gimmicks, but by contributing real computing resources to idle CPU and storage through the upcoming Nova App, tested in beta and now rolling out. What this unlocks is user access that doesn‚Äôt depend on wealth or technical skills. Earning BTC-S becomes something thousands can do while the phone sits unused ‚Äî making crypto yield part of daily life, not a speculative gamble. Performance That Matches the Pitch Bitcoin Solaris isn‚Äôt selling future deliverables. Its dual-layer blockchain architecture is already operational. At the base, Proof-of-Stake and Proof-of-Capacity deliver secure validation. The Solaris Layer stacks on top with Proof-of-History and Proof-of-Time ‚Äî enabling over 10,000 transactions per second, confirmed in under two seconds, using 99.95% less energy than legacy models. This isn‚Äôt a roadmap. These are tested outputs that redefine what accessibility in crypto infrastructure can mean. Security That‚Äôs Verified, Not Promised BTC-S stands out as one of the few early-stage projects with independent audits from day one. Cyberscope completed a full audit of its smart contract logic. Freshcoins reviewed its mobile mining backend. The team behind the project has undergone KYC verification , confirming their identities and roles. In an environment filled with anonymous wallets and speculative launches, this level of transparency offers something much rarer: accountability. Analyst Signals Confirm Market Interest Crypto researcher and influencer Ben Crypto released an in-depth breakdown this month, comparing Bitcoin Solaris‚Äôs architecture and incentive system to Bitcoin‚Äôs early days ‚Äî not in branding, but in structure. He highlighted that a fixed supply paired with permissionless earning access gives BTC-S a path to organic adoption not seen since Bitcoin itself gained traction post-2012. The community response reflects that confidence. More than 11,500 wallets have participated, and over $4.5 million has been raised without private rounds, venture allocations, or whitelist-only manipulation. The Final Window Is Narrowing Phase 7 is active, with BTC-S priced at $7. That presale window closes soon. After this, public listings are expected to begin around $20, with liquidity incentives and mining competition ramping up significantly. Waiting means paying more. It also means entering a much more competitive yield environment. For those still on the sidelines, there‚Äôs a very real choice to make: join the protocol while participation is affordable or watch from the outside once market attention drives exposure. title: HYPE price eyes $50 as Hyperliquid crosses $2b milestone
body: Hyperliquid jumped by 330% from its lowest level in April and could be on the verge of more gains after crossing a key $2 billion milestone. Hyperliquid‚Äôs ( HYPE ) price was trading at $40.4 on Sunday, June 15, a few points below the all-time high of $43.96. Its market capitalization has moved to $13 billion, while its fully diluted valuation rose to $40.75 billion. DeFi Llama data shows that the total value locked of Hyperliquid‚Äôs layer-1 chain has jumped to $2.01 billion after soaring by 70% in the last 30 days. This growth makes it the 11th biggest chain in the crypto industry, passing popular networks like Cardano, Hedera Hashgraph, and Near Protocol. The biggest players in Hyperliquid‚Äôs layer-1 network are Hyperliquid itself, Hyperlend, Felix, Morpho, and Hyperbeat. Further data shows that Hyperliquid has become one of the biggest players in the stablecoin industry. It has $3.7 billion of stablecoins in its layer-1 network, a big increase from $2 billion in January this year. You might also like: Bitcoin price eyes multi-year breakout as ETF inflows hit $1.3 billion An increase in stablecoin volume is a sign that the network is highly active. Most importantly, Hyperliquid is the sixth biggest player in the stablecoin industry after Ethereum, Tron, Solana, BNB Chain, and Base. Meanwhile, Hyperliquid‚Äôs perpetual exchange has continued to gain share in its industry. It handled over $4.43 billion worth of transactions in the last 24 hours, much higher than the other top-ten platforms combined. Its monthly volume jumped to $242 billion. More data shows that investors are staking their HYPE tokens, as the staking market cap has jumped by 16% in the last seven days to $17.1 billion. HYPE price technical analysis Hyperliquid price chart | Source: crypto.news The eight-hour chart shows the HYPE price has been in a strong uptrend in the past few months, moving from a low of $9.29 in April to $40 today. It has moved above the ascending trendline that connects the lowest points since May 12. Hyperliquid token is above the 50-period and 100-period moving averages and the key support at $39.94, the highest point in May. Therefore, the token will likely continue rising as bulls target an all-time high of $43.95. A move above that level will point to more gains, potentially to the psychological point of $50.
